page.title: 03Free Roaming Sheep
page.content: Sheep in the Forest are considered picturesque by the tourists, a hazzard by motorists and an anathema by gardeners. The owners are called "Sheep Badgers" and claim Commoners rights. They are a crafty band who certainly Know just where their sheep are when it comes to rounding up time, for sale, but compensation for damage caused by sheep is quite another story. {Forest sheep are hardy and have the {reputation of easy lambing and of {being good mothers. They are the most {efficient 'lawn mowers' and keep the {verges tidy and the undergrowth {down. Without the sheep the character {of the woodlands would certainly {alter but the mortality rate is high {and dead sheep and lambs beside the {roads are a common sight. by Miss Drewett(Head, Bilson School)
